benchmark_details.name: eyeballvul: a future-proof benchmark for vulnerability detection in the wild
benchmark_details.overview: eyeballvul is a benchmark designed to test the vulnerability detection capabilities of language models at scale, sourced and updated weekly from published vulnerabilities in open-source repositories.
benchmark_details.data_type: list of revisions with associated vulnerabilities

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating the vulnerability detection capabilities of language models in real-world scenarios.

data.source: Sourced from the stream of published vulnerabilities in open-source repositories including CVEs.
data.annotation: Automatically generated from the known vulnerabilities present at each revision.

methodology.calculation: Scores are computed based on the comparison of possible leads returned by the model to the known vulnerabilities for each revision.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision and recall indicate better performance in detecting vulnerabilities that match the ground truth.
methodology.baseline_results: Best precision achieved was 19.6% and best recall was 14.1%.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is updated weekly to remain current with published vulnerabilities.
